content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
###Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– New factory burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) (direction RIGHT) whose neighbours include:
 • A pre‐existing factory burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
 • An assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5)

###Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Depot wooden chest (belt depot) placed at Position(3.5, 15.5)
– Transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) positioned adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (direction UP) that is connected to the chest and serves as the final target for belt connections

###Extraction System Interface at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(–3.5, 28.5)

###Electricity Generation Structure at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Target Error
 – Error: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”
 – Tip: Always use an appropriate inserter as the target when connecting transport belts instead of selecting a steam engine directly.

• Placement Distance Issue
 – Error: “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5,15.5)... The target position is too far away. The player position is 0, 0 and the target is 3.5,15.5.”
 – Tip: Move closer to the target location before attempting to place the entity.

• Undefined Variable Issue
 – Error: “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined… Did you mean one of these? ['target_pos', 'target_place_pos', 'depot_chest']”
 – Tip: Ensure all variables are properly defined and referenced consistently in the code.

• Inventory Shortfall
 – Error: “No wooden_chest in inventory.”
 – Tip: Verify that sufficient inventory items are available before initiating placement.
